O2.summary: Wipe Any Terminals in the Building

description.S1: Sanjar wants the data on any terminals in the ARMS building deleted.

blurb.B1: You found Sanjar's executive review on the ARMS terminal. It was less than flattering.

description.S1: The BOLT-52 is in a locked closet.
description.S2: Find a way inside and retrieve it.

blurb.B1: Huxley's partner had the key to the door, but he was probably killed by raptidons.
blurb.B2: You might find the key on his body, or in a raptidon's stomach.
blurb.B3: You found the key to the closet.
blurb.B4: You can also ask Huxley to open the door from inside, it takes Perception, or Engineering (35), Intimidate (55) or Persuade (55).
blurb.B5: The door will open and Huxley will come outand you'll get Iconoclasts reputation.
blurb.B6: You can ask her for a reward, and obtain some Iconoclast reputation.
blurb.B7: Inside the room, loot Mag-Pick, Ammo and Bit Cartridge and the BOLT-52 Cartridge.

description.S1: Return the BOLT-52 to Sanjar in Stellar Bay.

blurb.B1: Return to Sanjar and tell him you saw the review.
blurb.B2: He will mention he even gave a kidney to the company in order to improve his chances of being promoted.
blurb.B3: You can encourage him for the part he plays now.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: What can I do for you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I found your review on a terminal in the ARMS building...

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: You weren't supposed to look! I asked you to delete it!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: This has been my albatross. The great shame of my career.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sorry. It was already open.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You could have told me what was on that terminal.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Yeah, you sent me into a raptidon-infested mess to clean up after you.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, yes. No doubt someone else was having a laugh at my expense before you.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yes, but then you would have known!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I didn't mean for any harm to come to you!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I gave MSI everything - my work, my youth, my left kidney - and for years, I was a joke to them.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Your left kidney?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who cares what they think? You're in charge now.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That much was definitely clear.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: One of the executives required a transplant.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I thought volunteering to donate might improve my prospects.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Did it?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're insane.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Apparently not.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's what you get for giving so much of yourself over to a corporation.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Perhaps they were right. After all, what have I built? Stellar Bay is barely keeping afloat.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Take it easy. You've kept this city running against all odds.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Do you want a medal? You're right, this place is a garbage heap.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: I hadn't thought of it that way. But perhaps there's something to that.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Thank you for that. Was there something else?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Please, I can't think about this right now. Celia, schedule thirty minutes of inconsolable weeping later today.

dialog.speaker: Celia (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'll pad it out with an extra fifteen, sir.

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now, was there something else you need?

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: No, I'm a company man!

dialog.speaker: sanjar_nandi (Male)
dialog.utterance: In charge of a scrap heap of a city. Abandoned by the Board and surviving only through the hypocrisy of our trading partners.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: And you've made it work. That's more than anyone can say for those execs.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: When you put it that way, it does sound pretty pathetic.
